# Datasets in `ds4psy` 


## `csv` files
The four tibbles can be downloaded directly from here, as `csv` files.

[`t_1.csv`](assests/datasets/ds4psy/t_1.csv)

[`t_2.csv`](assests/datasets/ds4psy/t_2.csv)

[`t_3.csv`](assests/datasets/ds4psy/t_3.csv)

[`t_4.csv`](assests/datasets/ds4psy/t_4.csv)


## `R` codes
`ds4psy` is a R package. There are several dataset in the package. The R package can be installed directly.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("ds4psy")
```
:::

After load the package, the four tibbles will be directly loaded.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ds4psy)
t_1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 8 × 9
  name  gender   age task_1 task_2 color color_time shape  shape_time
  <chr> <chr>  <dbl> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>      <dbl> <chr>       <dbl>
1 Ann   f         31 color  shape  red           73 circle         64
2 Bea   f         18 shape  color  blue          18 circle         42
3 Cat   f         42 color  shape  red           31 square         41
4 Deb   f         18 shape  color  blue          35 square         51
5 Ed    m         21 color  shape  red           71 circle         44
6 Fred  m         63 shape  color  blue          56 circle         63
7 Gary  m         22 color  shape  red           60 square         98
8 Hans  m         31 shape  color  blue          40 square         41
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
t_2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 8 × 5
  name  details task_1 color_time shape_time 
  <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <chr>      <chr>      
1 Ann   f:31    color  red = 73   circle = 64
2 Bea   f:18    shape  blue = 18  circle = 42
3 Cat   f:42    color  red = 31   square = 41
4 Deb   f:18    shape  blue = 35  square = 51
5 Ed    m:21    color  red = 71   circle = 44
6 Fred  m:63    shape  blue = 56  circle = 63
7 Gary  m:22    color  red = 60   square = 98
8 Hans  m:31    shape  blue = 40  square = 41
```
:::

 8 Deb   f         18        2 blue      35

10 Ed    m         21        2 circle    44
11 Fred  m         63        1 circle    63
12 Fred  m         63        2 blue      56

## `Python` codes
After the `csv` files are downloaded, you may also use `Python` codes to load them.



::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
t1 = pd.read_csv('t_1.csv')
t2 = pd.read_csv('t_2.csv')
t3 = pd.read_csv('t_3.csv')
t4 = pd.read_csv('t_4.csv')
```
:::
